name: Mitchell Hashimoto

top_projects.name: libxev
top_projects.description: libxev is a cross-platform, high-performance event loop that provides abstractions for non-blocking IO, timers, events, and more and works on Linux (io_uring or epoll), macOS (kqueue), and Wasm + WASI. Available as both a Zig and C API.

top_projects.name: zig-overlay
top_projects.description: Nix flake for the Zig compiler.

top_projects.name: zig-objc
top_projects.description: Objective-C runtime bindings for Zig (Zig calling ObjC).

top_projects.name: go-glint
top_projects.description: Component-based UI-framework for command-line tools. Easily create highly dynamic CLI interfaces using shared, easily testable components.

ghostty-org/ghostty.summary: The ghostty repository has been actively updated to address several key issues, including a rework of the input method handling in the GTK apprt to improve compatibility with both Wayland and X11, and a change to the default key bindings to capture full screen contents for better user experience. Multiple pull requests and push events have been made to resolve issues reported in discussions and issues such as #4332 and #189, demonstrating a strong focus on user feedback and continuous improvement.

mitchellh/nixos-config.summary: The nixos-config repository has seen recent updates with push events focused on improving the configuration, including the start of using specializations and updates to dependencies, indicating ongoing maintenance and refinement of the NixOS configuration for better performance and compatibility.

profile_summary: I'm Mitchell Hashimoto, a seasoned developer with a strong foundation in Go, C, and C++, driving innovation through my 128 public repositories and connected with a community of 16587 followers. With a passion for building scalable and efficient solutions, I leverage my technical expertise to craft high-quality software. Through my active engagement in the development community, I continuously expand my skill set and explore new avenues for growth and collaboration.
